ref: 3875 khārá m. ʻ a partic. measure ʼ lex., (in cmpds.) Pāṇ., khārīˊ -- f. ʻ a measure of grain ʼ RV., prob. hypersanskritism in kṣāraka -- ʻ net for catching birds ʼ MBh., ʻ cage or basket for fish or birds ʼ lex.
Pk. khārī -- f. ʻ a measure of capacity ʼ;
Pk. khārī -- f. ʻ a measure of capacity ʼ;

K. khār f. ʻ a dry measure, amount of land for which a kh˚ of rice seed is needed (about 4 acres) ʼ, khôru m. ʻ old worn basket work round a portable stove (often used for carrying fish) ʼ, khörü f. ʻ a large basket of withies ʼ;
S. khāro m., ˚rī f. ʻ open basket made of rushes ʼ;
P. khārā m., ˚rī f. ʻ large basket made of reeds ʼ;
P. khārā m., ˚rī f. ʻ large basket made of reeds ʼ;
bhal. khāru m. ʻ basket carried in the hand ʼ;
bhal. khāru m. ʻ basket carried in the hand ʼ;
A. khã̄rā, ˚ri ʻ a kind of basket ʼ;
Or. khāra ʻ a measure of grain ʼ;
H. khārā m. ʻ net for holding straw or grass ʼ;
G. khārī f. ʻ a measure of 60 pounds ʼ.
